channel.title: 508 help
channel.description:
When I put it in my bin folder... there are 4 folders
bin list cmd src
Do I go into cmd? and run the all file? When I do.. The system cannot find the path specified. The system cannot find the path specified. The system cannot find the path specified. The system cannot find the path specified. The system cannot find the path specified. The system cannot find the path specified. The system cannot find the path specified. The system cannot find the path specified. The system cannot find the path specified. The system cannot find the path specified. The system cannot find the path specified. Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: 508 help
item.dc:creator: @russian_b russian b
item.description:
@russian_b wrote:

in run.cmd right click it and click edit, Copy and paste EXACTLY THIS:

@echo off cd ../bin "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe" palidino76/rs2/Server 43594 pause

jdk1.6.0_07 is the latest jdk update but if you have another one change the 07 to whatever it is.

If it still sais “path cannot be specified” then go into your system variables, find where it says user variables for owner, and under that there is a whole bunch of stuff like classpath and path.

If you already have a thing that says “classpath” inside, then just edit it and put this in

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

if you dont create a new variable call it classpath and put that in.

Then find the “Path” variable and edit it and put this in-

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin;

Read full topic

item.title: 508 help
item.dc:creator: @stormcutter stormcutter
item.description:
@stormcutter wrote:

[quote=“Dart Zamaki, post:3, topic:236412”]{If you are doing what I think your doing } (if i’m wrong sorry)
But what you do is NOT to move any of the folders of them.

The cmd files, you have to edit them, and change them into your current java version.

And canging variables in 508 is diffrent from the current ones most people use. (If you are speaking of editing files.)

(I really don’t know, I can’t think this morning. Hope it helps.)[/quote]

Yes that will work.
